intro: Halimocnemis mollissima, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which are surrounded by soft, hairy leaves. Halimocnemis mollissima is adapted to sandy soils and is drought-tolerant, making it a hardy species in harsh environments. Its silky foliage and unique floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
